name: Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was for January 19, 2007 for one night. I booked the hotel through Priceline with a accepted bid of $75.00 + tax = $93.41 We arrive just before midnight and used the valet parking $38.00 as there is no self parking. Check in was fast.
reviews.title: Ikea meets simulated mahogany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Yes, it is a old hotel and updated as their website states however, I found the room to be very depressing. Ikea meets simulated Mahogany......... and who knew there were so many shades of brown. If I had paid full price for this hotel I would have been more depressed. The hotel served it’s purpose. We had a late flight from Boston to LA and we needed a hotel in LA for one night before continuing on to Laguna.
reviews.title: awful celebrity flophouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived at the Roosevelt with great anticipation. I was staying there on business and was promised that it was THE place to stay in Hollywood. I guess if you're a 21-year-old celebrity wannabe, the numerous discomforts wouldn't deter you.
reviews.title: Billy Bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: In no particular order, here are my complaints:
reviews.title: Classy hotel, lots of history, prefer the pool-area rooms

likes.liked: — Pool, poolside bar, poolside cabana rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: *hard-to-navigate entrance with numerous steps to the reception desk
reviews.title: Cool place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our Honeymoon , and we got a free upgrade since it was our Honeymoon.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First Great Location and for being out of towners, couldnt find a better spot.
reviews.title: Pool view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are standard from what we got, and the pool is a hot spot on the weekends. Also there is a club called teddys which is great for spotting some celebrities.
reviews.title: The Night of My Life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Def making this my home whenever I am in LA.
reviews.title: Heart of Hollywood Blvd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing hotel, in an amazing location. All staff whether theye were reception, valet, cleaners or bar staff were amazing and loved the 25 degrees restaurant downstairs. If I go back I would stay here again without a doubt!
reviews.title: Very good but not amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: This hotel caters to the leisure crowd. If your here to get some work done or for quiet relaxation, this is probably not the hotel for you. My girlfriend and I were here to have fun. We are older (31 and 43). It's definitely a younger crowd. Check in was smooth. Reception was pleasant. We received an upgrade to cabana room by pool. We parked across the street which was cheaper then valet ($20). When we got to our room my girlfriend was accosted by young, drunk partygoer. Normally this would have irritated me but we were there to have a good time so comes with territory. Pool area was beautiful, posh and hip. They have a party here most nights so if your staying near the pool be prepared to be up until 2 am. The hotel itself is historic and beautiful with its dark woods and leather couches. I am sure the rooms in the main hotel are much more quiet.
reviews.title: An entertaining hotel in the Heart of Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: As far as activities nearby the hotel is right across street from Graumanns Chinese theater and a hub of activity that is Hollywood Blvd. There are undesirables in the area which can make a walk at night uneasy. My girlfriend and I walked down to Runyon Canyon in the morning and went for a hike. It's about 3/4 miles away and was probably the highlight of our stay there. Wake up early and do it. Good for celebrity sightings.
reviews.title: Bad for business trip--Internet terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel served our needs to be in hollywood, sightsee, drink beverages and relax by the pool. It's a good stay for a day or two but not a place I would stay for any length of time.
reviews.title: Terrible Service, Terrible Room, Not for anyone over the age of 21.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do NOT book here if you have any work you have to get done. I find it unconscionable that a hotel this pricey doesn't provide free Internet of any kind to its customers, not even an ethernet cable in the room. And when I tried to sign onto the paid wifi system ($15) a day, I couldn't logon, so had to spend half my trip down the street at an Internet cafe. The rooms are okay, the bathrooms and pool nice, and the people who work here are generally helpful. But it's just far too expensive for what you get, and entirely impractical for a business trip. I booked here because I had work to do around the corner with Jimmy Kimmel Live, but between the Internet and the outrageous $33 a night for parking my car, I'm never booking here again. This is only for tourists without a car who want to walk around Hollywood and see the sights and come back to a place with a lively nighttime atmosphere.
reviews.title: Awesome!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel later in the evening, around 9PM. People were swarming around the valet service, waiting for cars and the hotel staff was trying to keep everything organized. We waded through the mass of people hauling two large suitcases, and checked in. The check in staff was horrible, young, and so focused on being trendy there customer service was lacking.
reviews.title: Star Quality
Trendy hotel
reviews.text: Stayed in a king studio and the room was very comfortable. The bathroom was the most comfortable hotel bathroom I have ever come across. The room was great, yes with a few nicks on the furniture but that didn't affect our stay. Great location. We hired a car so it was easy to drive anywhere we wanted to in LA. We are a young couple and did not at any time feel unsafe in the area, there were constantly people around. Service at hotel wAs great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good location, red line train is just few mins walking. Inside the hotel it's quite, bed very comfy. But room is a bit small. They have the Keurig coffee maker, and the k-cup costs $3.50 when you can just go down stair cross the street and get Starbucks. The room I stayed is right on the side where they have the sigh of the hotel so it's very bright during the night even with the curtain.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel. The hotel was very clean and the housekeeping crew exceeded my expectations. I loved the entertainment provided in the cabana area. The atmosphere was private,and professional.
reviews.title: Exceptional Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the heart of Hollywood Blvd. and the convenience of the most frequent tourist attractions. What I liked about this hotel was that with all of the busyness and noise of the traffic, I did not hear the outside excitement through my window. The hotel staff were professional and personable and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Iconic hotel on the Boulevarde

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving well before check in time after a long flight from Australia, we were told that our room was ready for us and that we could check in immediately. We were really happy after being "on the road" for nearly 24 hours. Our room faced Hollywood Boulevarde and was on the 7th floor. It was comfortable enough and I loved the print over the bed of Mick Jagger, David Bowie and Leo Sayer taken in the 70's! The bathroom was very small with the shower over the bath and not much room to put your toiletries anywhere, just a small shelf over the toilet. Apart from that it was a great place to stay. Across the road is the Graumann theatre and walk of fame, lots of places to see, lots of shops and restaurants. If you like buffets there is a new one across the road called Vegas Seafood Buffet. For just $20 you can dine on loads of fresh seafood and lots of other choices too. Most buffets leave a lot to be desired but this is a good one! Also loved the pharmacy there, you can buy your make up, get your prescription filled and buy booze and nibbles in one! The bars are really cool in the Roosevelt, dark and mysterious with amazing history. We really have nothing negative to say about this hotel, every staff member was courteous and friendly. We hired a car to drive to Vegas and arranged a car to Burbank to pick it up. The driver's name was Carlos, a really nice man who went over and above to help us and actually led the way to the freeway in his car to help us on our way. I would absolutely stay at the Roosevelt again if I went back to Hollywood, well worth it!!!
reviews.title: Party scene hotel, Overpriced room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Roosevelt from the 1st Jan - 6th Jan and were tempted to change our booking based on the number of bad reviews we read. However we are certainly glad we didn't! Yes the hotel is dark but it is part of it's ambience, and its unique interior design set it apart from the numerous other hotels were it not for a name would be almost interchangable. From the begining we got a good feeling, the bell boy was friendly, chatty and very informative. Our room was clean and reasonably spacious, and when we did have a plumbing issue in the bathroom the staff were polite, helpful and prompt. We had breakfast at Dakota most mornings and again found the staff to be great and the food delicious. The location is superb and you are as central as possible most of the must see LA. While I could see it would probably not be an ideal choice for people with a younger family, my husband and I both loved our stay there and would most definately stay there again if in LA.
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Checked in on the 30th for 3 nights. We really excited about celebrating the NYE here as we had received information from the Hotel the party would be massive. Anyway, upon check in we had to change room as the twin room was tiny - small enough you could not swing a cat and there was mould in the bathroom. They showed us another room which again was very small and again complained. We later received an upgraded room which was an extra $75.00 a night, and considering the bigger room etc we did not mind paying this. We then thought as we had not booked direct with the hotel and had paid vast cheaper rates that are why they tried to fob us off with a small, dingy dark room. Anyway, the staff was very relaxed and like most state on here are only there to help the real celebrities. However, the bar staff at the Tropicana Bar were lovely and this is where we spent most of our time. Drinks are a little over priced, but you are in the middle of Hollywood and the view from our room could not be better. As we opened the curtains what do we look at - nothing but the Hollywood sign. I had also been advised that the tickets for the NYE party were going to be $50.00 we nearly got charged $100 but got that down to $75.00 and since I have sent them the email confirming we would be charged $50.00 and since had the refund. Check your bill throughly upon departure.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Poor Staff

likes.liked: — Our iew overlooking the Hollywood sign

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the downs there were all the ups too and we did spot a celebrity or 2 here, but don't expect to get near to Teddy's - A listers only and you would be lucky even to find the entrance. One last thing, it is true that there are the ghosts of the Roosevelt Hotel, try standing in the Blossom Room in the dark on your own - you will soon realise it is true!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Pool party views are amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on a sunday and our room wasn’t ready so we were told to go sit by the pool and have a drink … oh my god … Each Sunday there is a ‘pool party’ which basically involves the best looking and richest teenagers / 20 somethings from LA getting drunk and throwing each other in the pool … I tell you, some of the ladies looked outstanding in their bikinis ….. anyway … I digress …
reviews.title: Embarassingly horrible experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: … the hotel was fabulous … very modern, great décor, fantastic location .. our room overlooked the Hollywood sign and the Chinese theatre and we walked out directly on the Hollywood walk of fame.
reviews.title: Smitten by the Roosevelt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We checked into the Roosevelt on Friday for a little R&R. I was excited to be back at the Roosevelt as we had stayed there before, and had a great time. I had requested one of the Cabana rooms, which are the ones by the pool that allow access to the Tropicana Bar, one of the LA hotspots. We were a little dissapointed to have missed the Victoria Secret Party the night before, but still kept our spirits up with a couple of cocktails from the bar ($26 plus tips for two bloddy marys). Our room was super deluxe with a great patio next to the pool, the corner spot was secluded enough that we didn't feel like we were in a fish bowl. Rooms service and maid service were prompt and attentive, and for a change they really won't disturb you if you leave the "Do Not Disturb" sign on your door, a variance from most hotels where maid staff take it to mean knock really softly. The action at the pool bar was less than we could have hoped (we heard that the summer months the place is packed) but it was nice for a couple of drinks before heading out. We ended up staying an extra day we were having so much fun...I would reccomend the Roosevelt to anyone visiting LA who wants to play movie star for the weekend, just be ready to pay movie star bills as well. The room was about 500 per night with taxes, and drinks were pricey as well.
reviews.title: Roosevelt, home of the stars and expensive bars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is so dark and dreary--they should be paying you to stay there. I am a travel agent and recently stayed here for one evening to see the Lion King down the street. First, you arrive by the back door because the front door is normally blocked off because something or someone is across the street at the Kodak (Jay-Z) on my trip. You had to walk down into a real dark reception area to get signed in. The employees are okay but not so smart--I was told that Sunset Blvd was blocked off for the Hollywood Christmas Parade (Five days later).
reviews.title: are you kidding
Going downhill fast
reviews.text: The rooms are also dark. Sink cracked, no top sheet, and in the Honor Bar they sell something called the "Shag Bag"-contains condoms and wipes--that pretty much sums up this hotel--

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here in 2005 and although the pool was closed for renovations, we had a nice room overlooking the theatre and felt the ambiance of Hollywood and the price was ok. So we went back again in 2006. We love Hollywood. Or did.
reviews.title: Refreshingly different.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Even paid for a Cabana room with a garden view thinking it would be even nicer.Much higher prices too. What a total disaster. The Cabana room was like the black hole of Calcutta. Drab, dark and musty. And the so called Garden had 3 plant pots and a lounger in a 10' x 10' area. The whole place had changed due to new owners. No Charlie Chaplin sitting at the entrance. The restaurant had changed also. The breakfast ho hum. The only thing we enjoyed was the hospitality of the Kiwi girl.
reviews.title: Don't Stay at the Roosevelt!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The courtesy of the bell person, Elmo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Roosevelt Hotel
reviews.title: Fun & Glamorous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Personally, I love this hotel – it’s fun & glamorous. I love the rooms, pool / pool scene, restaurants, staff, service, etc. I stayed in the Studio King w/Living Area room type. I found it to be quite spacious. The décor is modern, but warmer than what is traditionally thought of as minimal. It really appealed to me & I felt immediately at home in the room. The Lobby Bar is very relaxing & comfortable. The pool is beautiful & the Tropicana pool scene at night is quite fabulous. Teddy’s is also located here (note that staying at the hotel doesn’t guarantee access). 25 Degrees is a fun burger joint with a great veggie burger. There’s also a steakhouse, Dakota, though I didn’t go.
reviews.title: Over-rated closet

likes.liked: — Located in the heart of Hollywood
likes.disliked: — The rooms are small, outdated and dark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small details completed my experience – toiletries were from Fresh (mmnn!), in-room internet access was speedy, mini bar was stocked with everything that I could ever want from Dean & Deluca & some local brands, room service was prompt & great.
reviews.title: Great hollywood location
OK experience
reviews.text: Location is so-so. If you’re a tourist & want to do tourist-y things, then this is perfect for you! If you’re not interested in standard tourist activities, then you may prefer a different, calmer location. This is the equivalent of staying in Times Square in NYC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For the cons – a co-worker stayed here in a standard room & said it was awful – much, much smaller than the superior room that I’m raving about. Also, I understand that the valet parking charges are insane. If you are planning on driving or having guests over for dinner / pool party, you may want to look into alternate, less expensive parking options. & the bathroom is too dark to really get ready in. Darkness / ambiance shouldn’t carry over into the bathroom / vanity mirror area! & I had a minor problem with housekeeping, I would only say to make sure you call in to confirm any laundry / dry cleaning needs.
reviews.title: Pretty Cool Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here a second time and one of the few choices when staying in central Hollywood, a great easy jumping off point by train to Universal or Downtown and a short Metro Rapid ride to The Grove. A great landmark yes, but a great hotel no. We had a few greivances this time round... a smallish room (after an upgrade - yikes!) a leaking toilet...a half-hearted clean up. The pool seem to be crowded with wanna-bes who were drunk all the time seemed to further impress upon us that this hotel is more about facade than substance. However there are limited choices in the area but may give them a try next time round
reviews.title: Roosevelt Revamp Required

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There are many nice things that can and have been said about this hotel. I'm here to warn you that it's got an ugly greedy side and that I was negatively impressed with how they charged or tried to,at every turn. They don't offer complementary drinking water like many places - it's thoughtfully placed in your room, but for $10 a bottle. Same with coffee. Unlike other hotels that offer fair to great coffee,usually in one's room or in the lobby, this place charges you $3.50 a cup to make your own coffee in the pot in the room. Internet? Even the lowliest hotel includes internet. But no - only if you pay extra. They charge by the day. Not missing any marketing opportunity, it's even sold in speed tiers: Barely adequate and expensive or practically inadequate (500kbps) for slightly less.
reviews.title: Cheapskate hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I never turned on the TV, but doubt you could see any decent channels without an upcharge.
reviews.title: All Style, No Substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Towels ARE included in the room.
reviews.title: Renowned Landmark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought some beer to have in the room but were blocked by valets and informed that beer was not allowed to be brought in, could only drink the overpriced stuff they stock in the room fridge.
reviews.title: Wonderful room, great service
Could use some sprucing up!
reviews.text: The Roosevelt Hotel is a totally FINE experience for someone who wants to be out and about and enjoy LA. The price was reasonable enough, the rooms were fine, and there is a fun scene at the pool bar. As per other reviewers, the parking is expensive-- it is actually $28/day and we imagined we would just use public parking but all the parking nearby is closed overnight, so this is impossible. We looked at 5 rooms before we found one that was a reasonable size (and we were not in the cheapest room category) and then, picked one that smelled of smoke, because at least we could walk around it. The rooms were all quite worn-- chipped furniture, chipped bathtubs, but it did seem clean enough. All in all, I don't feel the need to COMPLAIN about the hotel, but I wouldn't give it a rave either. It is a good place to stay if you are in LA to have fun-- out and about during the day and on the town at night...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a very good historic hotel that has been extremely well restored (check out the lobby). Excellent location virtually opposite Grauman's theatre. The room was an ok size, sufficient for the 4 nights I stayed there.
reviews.title: Very good, couple of reservations
romantic honeymoon
reviews.text: Staff very helpful and friendly - excellent concierge. Nice pool and bar.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: Main gripe was that you can hear every word of your neighbours next door. No soundproofing in evidence -- I am encountering this problem regularly when I stay in hotels worldwide these days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that treat yourself to a nice merger of old and new Hollywood (also recommended an excellent steak at the hotels Dakota restaurant and propably the best burger I've ever had at 25 Degrees also on site).
reviews.title: Interesting

likes.liked: — Funky feel and close to the centre of Hollywood.
likes.disliked: — A little bit worn around the edges

reviews.title: Cool, Cool, Cool - a great place to stay.
reviews.text: As a traveling musician, I stayed at the Roosevelt while playing a show in Hollywood. My wife and I were issued a beautiful corner room overlooking the famed "Hollywood" sign and the Chinese theater out one window, and and the walk of fame, a great view of the city and other landmarks out the other window. The room was very modern, but homey, with a flat screen television, high speed internet, a very comfortable bed, and a great bathroom. Lots of storage space was nice as well.

reviews.title: Feel Like a Movie Star
reviews.text: As great as the accomodations were, the service is what really knocked me off my feet. Everyone on staff, from the waiters and waitresses, the front desk personel, the cleaning staff, and even the valet staff were very courteous, friendly and - gasp - helpful! Much different from what I expected in Los Angeles of all places.

reviews.title: The place to be
reviews.text: (If you're into it, we also saw a number of Celebrities while staying at the Roosevelt. Not necessarily my thing, but still kinda cool.....)

reviews.title: Loved the Roosevelt!
reviews.text: The restaurants in the hotel were top notch as well, especially 25 degrees, where I had one of the best gourment hamburgers I've ever tasted (at 4am in the morning, nonetheless). If you're in town to see the sights of Hollywood, there's probably no better place to stay. The price might be a deterrent to some, but if you want to truly experience the area, this is worth every penny.

reviews.title: There's better in LA
reviews.text: This is a great place for someone who wants to relax during the day, be close to tons of tourist attractions, and party at night. I stayed here on a business trip and was so sad when business got in the way. Great location, close to shopping, the chinese theatre, in and out burger, and everything LA. The pool is defintely amazing! The waitress service is a little slow but just relaxing in the sun on the comfy lounge chairs makes up for it. Great bar at the pool as well. The rooms were huge with tons of space. the bathrooms were a bit small but everything was extremely clean. The only issue we had with the hotel was that they lost our boxes for 12 hours. The staff decided to take a break and go watch the prince concert in the hotel and we were put behind our deadline by 12 hours. Make sure if you are shipping they check everywhere! Overall amazing experience and will defintely go back. Something is always happening at night and you are mixed in with the Hollywood A listers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on the night of the MTV Horror awards. If I had been one of your more pessimistic contributors , like earlier reviews, I would complain about the fact the main foyer was closed for an after award party. Instead we enjoyed the spectacle of monsters and zombies mixing with the beautiful people. The location is great with tour buses stopping at Manns Chinese Theatre the hotel is a tourist atraction. Tourist walk in to see the so called dingy foyer! Staff were great, got upgrade to junior suite. Breakfast was really good.Only problem , and the staff say they will address it, the curtains are not thick enough as there are floodlights pointing at the front of this historic building. The area has been upgraded a lot since i was last there with the exeption of a few tacky souvenir shops for the tourists. Walk of fame, kodak theatre, shopping mall, movies and metro. Visited Getti museum, fantastic. Went on local bus service which goes through Beverley Hills. Get timetable and all day ticket. Metro to Universal. Buskers and lookalikes/costumed locals parade all day so you can have a photo with your favourite star? Top class hotel
reviews.title: Really cool place

likes.disliked: — Lack of dark in the rom at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights as a friend recommended it, we found a great deal on a website and paid for the basic room.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were upgraded to a Cabana Room, I can only describe it as fabulous.
reviews.title: Loved it and would stay again in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: You are given a typed sheet of instructions to tell you the dress code for the Tropicana Bar and the admittance policy and the dates during your stay when certain areas of the hotel are closed eg lobby closed for MTV party, that sort of thing. Also on returning at night we had to go past about 5 security people to get to our room but such security is commendable in this day and age.
reviews.title: Very trendy!

likes.disliked: — $5 parking lot just round the corner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff are all very pleasant, the pool is beautiful, they serve complimentary coffee there in the mornings.
reviews.title: Very pleased with the hotel, location, and the room.
Loved the Roosevelt
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel for a short girls weekend to L.A (my friends and I are 30). The hotel is in a perfect location to many great restaurants and night clubs. The entire hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating, particularly the bellmen and concierge service. The hotel itself is very nice including the pool area, the weather was a little cool for us so we did not spend much time by the pool, if it had been warmer I think the pool area would have been great. The only time we actually ate at one of the hotel restaurants was for lunch by the pool, the food was excellent. The hotel rooms were very spacious, we had 4 girls in one room and did not have any issues with it feeling too crowded compared to other places we have stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also were a little concerned with some of the reviews we had read but had no issues getting whatever we needed as far as room service/housekeeping and overall just very friendly service.
reviews.title: Scarey neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone. I would also strongly recommend that guests use the concierge service. They are absolutely wonderful here (Andrea and Ben) and were very helpful to us with getting reservations, recommendations on where to go, answering our questions, etc. We had a great time at the Roosevelt and will definately stay here again the next time we come to L.A.!
reviews.title: Not a 4 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Roosevelt Hotel is nice with nice pool. Very dark interior. On a scarey street with many homeless. Many young people staying there. I'm only 43!?! Not for kids. The pool and bar turns into a really cool atmosophere at night with fireplaces, etc. Perfect to see Jimmy Kimmel show though.
reviews.title: An 'OK' Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is not a 4 star in my book. It may have been so when Roosevelt was president, but not any longer. The service was good, but the room was a bit of a beater. For example, the paint/varnish on the wood trim was considerably chipped and worn. The rooms could use remodeling. The room was very small for American standards. There was little room to walk around or place luggage. The bath was quite small as well.
reviews.title: Week in California

likes.liked: — Room was very clean, bed was very comfortable
likes.disliked: — The lighting in the room made it difficult to see to get ready to go out.

description: Bringing glamour back to the Boulevard, Thompson’s Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel reincarnation resonates with the opulence of its fabled past. Located in the heart of Hollywood on the Walk of Fame across from the Grauman’s Chinese Theater, The Roosevelt houses some of the hottest drinking and eating venues on the west coast. These include the famous poolside Tropicana Bar, celebrity haunt Teddy’s nightclub, The Library bar which is acclaimed for its hand crafted cocktails, The Spare Room, a speakeasy gaming lounge featuring vintage bowling lanes and classic cocktails, and vaudeville inspired theater Beacher’s Madhouse. Public Kitchen and Bar serves eclectic American fare in a social atmosphere and award winning 24 Hour burger joint 25 Degrees offers a variety of dining options. To top it off, the hotel’s heated outdoor swimming pool provides guests the only locale in the world where they can swim in a million dollar work of art painted by acclaimed artist David Hockney. The hotel is constantly buzzing with the entertainment industry’s glitterati.
